subject: Re: [junit] Class Not Found "AllTests"
msgSnippet: But one typically gets a more explicit message in this case. ... -- Fergus Gallagher          Tel: +44 (20) 8742 1600 Orbis                     Fax: +44 (20)
messageBody:
But one typically gets a more explicit message in this case.


On Mon, Jun 10, 2002 at 10:30:50PM +0100, Manuel Amago wrote:
> > Does your CLASSPATH include that directory? You can be in the
> > directory all
> > you want, but if your CLASSPATH can't see it, you might as well be on
> > Pluto. :)
>
> Plus, if AllTests is in a package, you don't need to be, in fact, you
> don't WANT to be, at the directory it is at. You want to be at the root
> of the package hierarchy.
>
> Manuel Amago.
> mailto:mamago@...
